Where to find all sorts of Caribbean cuisine, seafood galore, rooftop lamb chops, and more

by [Tierney Plumb](https://www.eater.com/authors/tierney-plumb)

Updated

[Tierney Plumb](https://www.eater.com/authors/tierney-plumb) is an editor of Eater’s Northeast region, covering D.C., Boston, Philly, and New York.

Eater writers and editors always get the same question. Friends, family, acquaintances, and randos all want to know, “Where should I eat right now?” That’s where the Eater Heatmap enters the conversation, pointing diners toward the most intriguing or otherwise buzzy new restaurants in the D.C. area. # The Best New Restaurants in D.C., December 2025

Where to find all sorts of Caribbean cuisine, seafood galore, rooftop lamb chops, and more

by [Tierney Plumb](https://www.eater.com/authors/tierney-plumb)

Updated

[Tierney Plumb](https://www.eater.com/authors/tierney-plumb) is an editor of Eater’s Northeast region, covering D.C., Boston, Philly, and New York.

Eater writers and editors always get the same question. Friends, family, acquaintances, and randos all want to know, “Where should I eat right now?” That’s where the Eater Heatmap enters the conversation, pointing diners toward the most intriguing or otherwise buzzy new restaurants in the D.C. area. This list considers restaurants that have been open for six months or less. For the hottest new bars in D.C., go [here](/maps/best-new-bars-dc). And for our map of the region’s 38 essential restaurants, go [here](/maps/dc-best-restaurants-38).

**New to the list:** U Street’s modern brasserie **Bonne Vie**, Logan Circle’s all-day global cafe **Sook**, and soup-centric **Springbone Kitchen** in Georgetown.

[*For all the latest Washington D.C. dining intel, subscribe to Eater DC’s newsletter.*](/2017/3/31/15143424/eater-dc-restaurant-newsletter?utm_campaign=eater.social&utm_content=eater&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=dc-map)

## Acqua Bistecca

James Beard Award-winning chef Michael Mina, the West Coast-based visionary behind Georgetown stalwart [Bourbon Steak](https://www.bourbonsteak.com/location/washington-dc/), doubles down on D.C. with a coastal Italian restaurant in the glossy City Ridge development near Tenleytown. [Acqua Bistecca](https://theminagroup.com/restaurants/acqua-bistecca-washington-dc/) showcases house-made pastas, grilled seafood (striped bass, black bass, Maine lobster), char-grilled steaks brushed with lambrusco butter; vibrant crudos. A striking mirrored bar in the back sends out spritzes and other seaside cocktails like the Capri (clarified milk punch with bourbon, tomato water, and basil). Mina tells Eater he envisions Acqua as a “dinner party,” and groups of six or more can order coursed spreads.

* [10 Ridge Square Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20016, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Acqua%20Bistecca%2C%2010%20Ridge%20Square%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020016%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://theminagroup.com/restaurants/acqua-bistecca-washington-dc/)

Rey Lopez

## Qui Qui

Shaw’s Puerto Rican favorite [Qui Qui](https://www.quiquidc.com/) [relocated](/openings/164340/qui-qui-puerto-rican-park-view-dc-restaurant-openings) to a breezy, flag-flying, Bad-Bunny-playing prime corner spot in Park View. Chef-owner Ismael Mendez maintains his restaurant’s Caribbean essence, but now with a larger kitchen and bar. Apps include local oysters, alongside aji dulce mignonette; octopus and other ceviche; aguacate salad; pastelitos stuffed with beef; salt cod fritters; and chicken skewers doused in a deep and fruity guava barbecue sauce.

* [3227 Georgia Avenue Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20010, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Qui%20Qui%2C%203227%20Georgia%20Avenue%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020010%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.quiquidc.com/)

Qui Qui

## Maison Bar à Vins

The family-run hospitality group behind celebrated D.C. dining institutions [Lapis](https://www.lapisdc.com/), [Lutèce](https://www.lutecedc.com/), and [Pascual](https://www.pascualdc.com/) debuted [a fanciful wine bar in a decked-out Adams Morgan brownstone.](/openings/163523/maison-bar-a-vins-wine-bar-adams-morgan-dc-restaurant-openings) [**Maison Bar à Vins**](https://www.maisondc.com/) is centered around a cozy, green marble bar, with a list of cocktails that feature wines and wine-based ingredients, with a thousand-plus wine cellar list that mostly pulls from France and more than 30 options by the glass. Chef Matt Conroy leads a menu of small and shared plates, including taramosalata-filled choux buns, pastoral terrines, creamy-savory smoked eel croquette, and larger plates like a rich brioche-stuffed chicken breast with mushrooms.

* [1834 Columbia Road Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20009, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Maison%20Bar%20%C3%A0%20Vins%2C%201834%20Columbia%20Road%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020009%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.maisondc.com/)

Deb Lindsey

## Bonne Vie Café & Bistro

Bonne Vie Café & Bistro took over the two-story space previously occupied by Baby Shank last month. Billed as a casual sister of downtown’s [Le DeSales](https://www.ledesales.com/), the polished new bistro stars a three-course menu with one big draw: unlimited fries. A la carte options are available, too. Lined with vintage Parisian prints and chic sofa seating, guests can feast on pate de campagne, burrata, skirt steak, and tuna carpaccio over French 75s and espresso martinis. Enjoy dinner with a side of live jazz on Thursdays.

* [1604 U Street Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20001, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Bonne%20Vie%20Caf%C3%A9%20%26%20Bistro%2C%201604%20U%20Street%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020001%2C%20United%20States)
* [(202) 573-8031‬](tel:2025738031)
* [Visit website](https://www.bonneviedc.com/)

## Sook

Rose Previte’s neighborhood favorite, [Compass Rose](/venue/10074/compass-rose), transformed into new all-day cafe and wine bar [Sook](https://www.sookdc.com/?utm_source=ig&utm_medium=social&utm_content=link_in_bio&fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAc3J0YwZhcHBfaWQMMjU2MjgxMDQwNTU4AAGnbDis--5fsZbeloxV8mAUYTYWzWXcZVp-Tnpp_wp6AGO7bpkQ9vHyoNBGmDw_aem_nB7_zvQ0XOG1Ux5UMQGqaA) last month. To start the day, Sook serves za’atar toast, pistachio buns, labneh yogurt with granola and apricots, and a traditional Lebanese breakfast platter of feta, manoushe (flatbread), Persian cucumber, and tomatoes served on labneh. More American-style offerings include a bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich or an everything-spiced croissant. A coffee program fueled by Takoma Park’s Lost Sock Roasters includes specialty drinks like a fig leaf latte and ginger tamarind espresso tonics.

* [Book a table](https://reservations.safegraph.com/reserve/6434?utm_source=safegraph&utm_campaign=poi)
* [1346 T Street Northwest, DC, 20009](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Sook%2C%201346%20T%20Street%20Northwest%2C%20DC%2C%2020009)
* [(202) 506-4765](tel:2025064765)
* [Visit website](https://www.sookdc.com/)

Rey Lopez/Eater DC

## Chai Pani

Chef-restaurateur Meherwan Irani’s super-popular Indian standby in Asheville, N.C., named [Outstanding Restaurant](https://carolinas.eater.com/2022/6/14/23167159/north-carolina-james-beard-awards) at the 2022 James Beard Awards, landed at the foot of the [Gables Union Market](https://gablesunionmarket.com/) apartment complex in late August. [Chai Pani](https://www.chaipani.com/asheville), which literally means “tea and water,” consistently draws huge lines outside of its 16-year-old home base (and Atlanta offshoot) for chaat and other flavorful Indian street snacks. In addition to a prominent chaat section, expect butter chicken, baingan bharta, and masala curries, house-made mango lassi, and colorful cocktails starring tamarind and lemongrass.

* [1325 5th Street Northeast, STE A, Washington, District of Columbia 20002, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Chai%20Pani%2C%201325%205th%20Street%20Northeast%2C%20STE%20A%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020002%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://chaipani.com/dc-menu)

Tim Robison

## Realm

Vet chef Keem Hughley, who gained notoriety for running now-closed [Bronze on H Street](/2022/4/13/23002031/maketto-h-street-bronze-afrofuturism-coming-attractions), returned to the kitchen this fall to lead a sleek new Shaw rooftop inspired by the flavors of the island nation of Seychelles. A menu full of Indian and Afro-Caribbean influences include Caribbean flatbread drizzled with house-made curry sauce, lump coconut crab cakes, smoked fish dip made from Seychellean barramundi, and tamarind-glazed lamb lollipops. He does double duty on the cocktail front, developing drinks like a Trade Winds (bourbon, tamarind syrup and orange bitters). Sip it in the snazzy lounge or around a fire pit on the scenic patio.

* [899 O Street Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20001, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Realm%2C%20899%20O%20Street%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020001%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.realmrooftopdc.com/)

Realm

## Cowbell Seafood & Oyster

Chef Reid Shilling and Sara Quinteros, the husband-wife duo behind [Shilling Canning Co.](https://shillingcanning.com/) — the hyper-local [Navy Yard restaurant that closed after a six-year run](/dc-restaurant-closings/164219/dc-restaurant-closings-october-2025) — bring dockside nostalgia to Union Market, [going all in on a new sit-down spot called Cowbell Seafood & Oyster](/coming-attractions/164277/cowbell-seafood-union-market-dc-coming-attractions). Freshly shucked local oysters on ice, Baltimore-style crab cakes, chowder fries with smoked bacon, and crispy fried chicken tenders will be the mainstays at the nautical restaurant opening in the heart of the food hall. Other seafood dishes include scallop crudo, chilled Baltimore Canyon lobster, the Louie salad, and blue catfish dredged in beer batter.

* [1309 5th St NE, Washington, DC, 20002, US](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Cowbell%20Seafood%20%26%20Oyster%2C%201309%205th%20St%20NE%2C%20Washington%2C%20DC%2C%2020002%2C%20US)
* [202-204-2559](tel:2022042559)
* [Visit website](https://www.cowbellseafood.com/)

## Springbone Kitchen

NYC-born Springbone Kitchen made its anticipated D.C. debut on Friday, December 5. Springbone’s entirely gluten-free menu showcases nutrient-dense bone broths served in portable coffee cups, plus warming soups, grain bowls packed with proteins, and its own line of hot sauce. Springbone also individually packages its desserts made with almond flour and coconut sugar. The sleek, 20-seat space also debuts with a bone broth hot chocolate fit for winter.

* [1426 Wisconsin Avenue Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20007, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Springbone%20Kitchen%2C%201426%20Wisconsin%20Avenue%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020007%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://springbone.com/)

Leticia Almeida Photography

## Eunoia

The Bulgarian owners of Toolbox Pilates Art Studio double down on their Union Market district space with the September opening of Eunoia — a unique restaurant with a knack for fermentation and wellness. Mexico City-born chef Josa Maldonado sends out seaweed mole with potato miso, chicken skin and greens; smoked and pressed striped bass with guajillo adobo, yellow corn tortilla and farmhouse cheese; and for dessert, kakigori — a Japanese shaved ice delicacy served with cherry-kombucha balsamic and churros.

* [320 Florida Avenue Northeast, Washington, District of Columbia 20002, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Eunoia%2C%20320%20Florida%20Avenue%20Northeast%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020002%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.eunoiadc.com/home)

Rey Lopez/Eunoia

## (h)ours at Manifest 002

The modernist Adams Morgan barbershop with a cozy, dark speakeasy opens a second outpost called [Manifest 002](https://manifest.us/?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAaeOErutPtZq7uT4d9GxPUwm-pImA2sySeex8f0eVLq_i3FnKKeH4cb8eyNRTg_aem_-ZCvCS7kc86SbjoL0HeReA) in NoMa, a 9,700-square-foot space that includes a barbershop, coffee shop, clothing store, restaurant, cocktail lounge, and hidden speakeasy. Chef Erik Bruner-Yang ([Providencia](https://www.barprovidenciadc.com/), [Maketto](https://maketto1351.com/)) creates the menu in the (H)ours dining room, filled with everything from white Bolognese to whole fried lobster and Beijing duck bites. There’s also a social club aspect to Manifest, with [members paying almost $90 a month](https://manifest.us/products/subscription-product?srsltid=AfmBOordCK3wPPWHifRl222elxS1wvkaT0MTyNensjKxfBBi4nem8dW-) for special barber services, exclusive shopping products, preferred access to bar and restaurant reservations, complimentary coffee, and more.

* [1242 3rd Street Northeast, Washington, District of Columbia 20002, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=(h)ours%20at%20Manifest%20002%2C%201242%203rd%20Street%20Northeast%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020002%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://manifest.us/?srsltid=AfmBOop6OhivvQiayL36XrKvEUEtPha482rzBaL4q6dJHd3F19FDG4Bh)

Vina Sananikone/Manifest

## Selva

Open since July, [Selva](https://www.selvadc.com/) specializes in Central and South American classics — from Peruvian chicken and continent-spanning ceviches, to playful takes on internationally beloved dishes like patatas bravas made with crispy bites of yuca. Executive chef Giovanni Orellana is creating dishes inspired by his birthplace of El Salvador and his decades-long culinary career working at Peruvian, Italian, and Mexican restaurants. Mayflower Club owner Antonis Karagounis is behind the new restaurant, which is his first sit-down spot since opening Rewind Diner in 2018. The verdant green artwork and velvet furniture make the cozy restaurant – named after the Spanish word for “jungle” – the perfect place to have a filling meal and ease into a night out, with plenty of tasting flights of liquors distilled across the Americas and the Mayflower Club on the floor below.

* [1223 Connecticut Avenue Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20036, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Selva%2C%201223%20Connecticut%20Avenue%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020036%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.selvadc.com/)

## Florería Atlántico and Brasero Atlántico

Two standout Argentinian siblings known for sizzling steaks and acclaimed cocktails make their hotly anticipated stateside debut this fall. Buenos Aires-born Florería Atlántico and Brasero Atlántico open in tandem along the banks of Georgetown’s C&O Canal. Its founder, Renato “Tato” Giovannoni, converted what used to be D.C.’s oldest firehouse into an ambitious venture that starts with an enchanting flower shop stocked with natural wines sold until 2 a.m. One door over, there’s the restaurant, Brasero Atlántico, that greets diners with a striking grill firing up the prime cuts of meat Argentina is known for. Brasero Atlántico is joined below by Florería Atlántico, its famed basement bar in Buenos Aires that currently [ranks among the World’s 50 Best](https://www.theworlds50best.com/bars/the-list/floreria-atlantico.html).

* [1066 Wisconsin Avenue Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20007, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Florer%C3%ADa%20Atl%C3%A1ntico%20and%20Brasero%20Atl%C3%A1ntico%2C%201066%20Wisconsin%20Avenue%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020007%2C%20United%20States)
* [Visit website](https://www.floreriaatlanticodc.com/)

## Isla

Billed as “a luxe ode to island ingredients and flavors,” [**Isla**](https://isladc.com/?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAafspb9_8tpEUjvvSO98fvucYP8QFiu_H-ifF1OPSFeR9M_WezCyuFdn9eBltA_aem_EdgwumNvozrB3YvxlFf4Iw) made a flashy October debut [in Nick Stefanelli’s former Pilotimo space](/daily-restaurant-news/163936/goodlove-isla-downtown-dc-coming-attractions). The elegantly designed project comes from executive chef Lonie Murdock and her partner Darren Hinds, the veteran restaurateurs behind Toronto-based We Shall Hospitality. Born to a Caribbean mother and Canadian father, Murdock’s bicultural upbringing shines in dishes like a bone-in pork chop featuring smoked cumin, green-mango kuchela jus, grilled green mango, and crab butter. Cocktails include an espresso martini and peanut punch mashup and a clarified milk punch rum and Coke. Adjoining sibling Goodlove, opening this week, promises daily happy hour, small bites from Isla’s kitchen, and a late-night vibe full of rock, house, and R&B music.

* [1100 15th Street Northwest, DC, 20005](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Isla%2C%201100%2015th%20Street%20Northwest%2C%20DC%2C%2020005)
* [(202) 733-4800](tel:2027334800)

## Gigi's Pasta

A cheery new pasta place adorned with colorful tiles and a canopy of lemons debuted in the heart of Western Market food hall this week. Build-your-own bowls featuring all sorts of pasta shapes made on-site join beef Bolognese, baked lasagna, bottled Aperol spritzes, and free focaccia with every order. Order for takeout or dine on-site on a yellow stool.

* [2000 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, DC, 20006](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Gigi's%20Pasta%2C%202000%20Pennsylvania%20Avenue%20Northwest%2C%20DC%2C%2020006)
* [(202) 452-0924](tel:2024520924)

## Omakase Room by Tadayoshi

Tadayoshi Motoa, the tenured sushi chef behind Spain’s one-Michelin-starred Toki, makes his stateside debut inside the historic Federal-American National Bank building. The new namesake counter called Omakase Room by Tadayoshi centers around a 20-course tasting menu ($200) accented by premium sake, curated wine pairings, and zero-proof options. The tiny, 12-seat venture completes the trifecta of downtown D.C. dining options from [NYC hospitality firm the Group](https://www.thegroupus.com/) that includes French brasserie [La Grande Boucherie](https://www.boucherieus.com/) and Italian trattoria [Olio e Più](https://www.olioepiu.com/) on the same block.

* [699 14th Street Northwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20005, United States](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Omakase%20Room%20by%20Tadayoshi%2C%20699%2014th%20Street%20Northwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020005%2C%20United%20States)

## J. Hollinger's Waterman's Chophouse

**Open for:** Dinner and AYCE Sunday brunch

**Price range:** $$

Restaurateur Jerry Hollinger ([the Daily Dish](/venue/29375/the-daily-dish-a-restaurant-catering-company) and the Dish & Dram) delivered to downtown Silver Spring an Art Deco-styled American chophouse and raw bar celebrating local farmers, watermen, and purveyors. Shrimp and pork belly toast adorned with homemade kimchi are good ways to start; follow those with Rohan duck confit, homemade spinach ricotta ravioli, or anything from the luxe lineup of steaks. Augment dishes with underwater add-ons like butter-poached crab, lobster, jumbo shrimp, and fried oysters. A whale of a deal is in store during happy hour (4 p.m. to close and all night on Tuesdays), when oysters are just $1, and a robust bar program stars New York Sours and fig-sage rye cocktails.

**Vibe check:** The throwback space near the Fillmore takes tips from Sinatra’s era.

* [(301) 328-0035](tel:3013280035)
* [Visit website](https://jhollingers.com/)

## Aventino Cucina

**Open for:** Brunch, lunch, and dinner

**Price range:** $$

One of the newest spots from Italian hitmaker Mike Friedman, known for [Red Hen](/2021/1/14/22230739/red-hen-pivot-regional-italian-pop-ups-coronavirus-takeout-delivery-d-c) and [All-Purpose](/2018/3/21/17148650/all-purpose-navy-yard-opening), [landed](/2024/1/23/24048157/roman-cuisine-bethesda-ap-pizza-aventino-mike-friedman-dc-restaurant-openings) in Bethesda in January 2024 with dishes that evoke the longstanding culinary traditions of Rome and Italy’s Lazio region. The sprawling emerald- and gold-covered dining room transports diners with airy pizza rossa, light salads like the citrus and fennel-filled agrumi, and fantastic pastas that steal the show. House-made dried pastas make up classic Roman dishes, like creamy cacio e pepe and all’amatriciana zipped up with Calabrian chiles. But there are more experimental bowls on the menu as well, like a springtime toothsome cavatelli with a crushed broccoli and ricotta sauce and toasted almond-chile crunch on top. Don’t miss out on dessert options like a chocolate torte balanced with blood orange and earl grey gelato or affogato served with an Italian butter cookie and Madagascar vanilla gelato.

**Best for**: A spritz-fueled happy hour, especially with spritz and pasta pairings for $22 from 5 to 6 p.m. Monday through Thursday at the bar.

* [4747 Bethesda Avenue, Bethesda, Maryland 20814](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Aventino%20Cucina%2C%204747%20Bethesda%20Avenue%2C%20Bethesda%2C%20Maryland%2020814)
* [(301) 961-6450](tel:3019616450)
* [Visit website](https://aventinocucina.com/)

## Cielo Rojo

**Open for:** Lunch, dinner

**Price range:** $

The Takoma Park favorite for vegan-friendly Mexican fare since 2018 [moved into stylish new digs up the street last year](/2024/1/12/24035944/takoma-park-hit-cielo-rojo-dc-restaurant-openings). Husband-and-wife owners David Perez and Carolina McCandless turn to hand-pressed tortillas made with nixtamalized heirloom corn to produce an array of sophisticated tacos, ahi tuna tostadas, and savory enchiladas with tres moles. Crunchy pepitas add a pleasantly surprising crunch to quesadillas that can be ordered with vegan cashew cheese. Besides fabulous margaritas, the chic bar sends out inventive mezcal and rum-based cocktails. Brunch calls for brioche French toast with mezcal mascarpone, chilaquiles rojo, and a nopales (cactus) scramble Chef de cuisine Rachel Bindle formerly cooked at Michelin-starred Gravitas, and the growing team recently flipped Cielo’s old space into San Francisco-styled San Pancho Burritos.

**If you drive:** Feel free; Takoma Park is still blessed with parking.

* [7211 Carroll Avenue, Takoma Park, Maryland 20912](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Cielo%20Rojo%2C%207211%20Carroll%20Avenue%2C%20Takoma%20Park%2C%20Maryland%2020912)
* [Visit website](https://www.cielo-rojo.com/)

## 2Fifty Texas BBQ (Multiple locations)

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner

**Price range:** $

Riverdale Park, Maryland is long home to drive-worthy brisket, courtesy of Fernando González and Debby Portillo. The couple behind [wildly successful](/2021/12/8/22811842/2fifty-texas-bbq-dc-restaurant-history) 2Fifty pay homage to Central Texas by using oak smoke to develop a dark bark on fatty hunks of prime and American wagyu beef that jiggle on the chopping block. Beef ribs, pulled pork, sliced turkey, and St. Louis-style ribs are all available, while daily specials like brisket tacos, lamb ribs, pastrami sandwiches, and barbecue pupusas give the kitchen a creative outlet, and González and Portillo excitingly nod to their [Salvadoran heritage](/2021/12/8/22811842/2fifty-texas-bbq-dc-restaurant-history) in sides like red kidney beans braised with brisket and coleslaw interspersed with raisins. Mondays recently joined the fold (still closed Tuesdays), with [preorder](https://order.toasttab.com/online/2fifty-bbq-riverdale) for pickup; devour meats there or take the loot to go. To D.C. diners’ delight, 2Fifty [expanded with a sit-down smokehouse in Mt. Vernon Triangle](/2023/7/6/23785706/2fifty-meats-mt-vernon-triangle-coming-attractions) [last year](/2024/1/16/24040019/2fifty-texas-bbq-first-dc-customers-restaurant-openings).

**Know before you go:** Lines can get long, especially on weekends.

* [4700 Riverdale Rd, Riverdale Park, MD 20737, USA](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=2Fifty%20Texas%20BBQ%20(Multiple%20locations)%2C%204700%20Riverdale%20Rd%2C%20Riverdale%20Park%2C%20MD%2020737%2C%20USA)

## Thip Khao

**Open for:** Dinner only

**Price range:** $$

Considered the standard-bearer for Lao cuisine in D.C., Thip Khao comes from mother-and-son chefs Seng Luangrath and Boby Pradachith. Their Columbia Heights standby continues to satisfy heat-seekers with a menu full of fermented fish sauce, a heavy dose of chiles, offal, and cured meats. Hit orders include crispy tamarind-glazed wings, grilled pork shoulder with lemongrass, and a fiery Lao papaya salad with eggplant. Over in Shaw, the space that formerly housed the team’s cocktail bar Hanumanh recently turned into a modern Southeast Asian eatery called Baan Mae. The more casual Laotian spot is known for [hosting chef pop-ups](https://www.baanmaedc.com/pop-up) and also serves [$15 bowls of noodles for brunch.](https://www.baanmaedc.com/menu) If you find yourself out in the suburbs, the family’s Northern Virginia staple Padaek recently [settled into a new Arlington home](/2023/5/10/23717540/thip-khao-family-announces-big-changes-to-its-lao-portfolio-this-spring).

**Best for:** Family-style dining, bring a group of friends or family that are down to try an array of dishes

## Purple Patch

**Open for:** Brunch, lunch, and dinner daily

**Price range:** $$

*The Washington Post* called Purple Patch [the 2023 Restaurant of the Year](https://www.washingtonpost.com/food/2023/10/02/purple-patch-dc-restaurant-of-the-year/) eight years after the Mount Pleasant spot debuted as one of D.C.’s first upscale local Filipino restaurants, now the institution is celebrating [10 years of feeding D.C. diners](https://www.instagram.com/p/DHKVrT9M39g/?hl=en). The sizzling, spicy pork belly and pork shoulder sisig remains a favorite dish, along with such staples as longanisa (sweet garlic sausage) and tocino (sweet grilled pork). There are also a surprising number of satisfying vegetarian dishes on the menu, with highlights like sweet and spicy calamansi tofu with pineapple fried rice and three different umami-packed vegetarian adobos (eggplant, cauliflower, or a seasonal mushroom and carrot). You also can’t leave without trying an ube-flavored dessert (which you can also snag from their shop upstairs) or the ube waffle with fried chicken marinated in soy sauce and vinegar at brunch. Chef and owner Patrice Cleary, who was born in the Philippines, also opened casual [Joia Burger](https://www.joiaburgerdc.com/) a block away [last year](/2024/3/6/24091958/inside-joia-mt-pleasant-new-burger-joint-filipino-dc-restaurant-openings), serving up wagyu beef smash burgers or housemade bean burgers with chopped toppings and ube soft serve. A second Joia recently debuted in Glover Park. Even [celebrities](https://www.instagram.com/p/DIE_p3fPDBj/?hl=en) like [comedian Jo Koy have made a stop in Mount Pleasant to praise Cleary’s cooking.](/2025/2/28/24374429/comedian-jo-koy-dc-chef-purple-patch-am-intel)

**Vibe check:** The small indoor space was newly renovated during the pandemic but the covered patio remans the best spot at Purple Patch, with moody twinkle lights, purple curtains, and great people watching on Mount Pleasant Street.

* [Book a table](https://reservations.safegraph.com/reserve/2982?utm_source=safegraph&utm_campaign=poi)

## Perry's Restaurant

**Open for:** Dinner, drag brunch and select breakfasts

**Price range:** $$$

Perry’s has long been an under-the-radar reliable spot for sushi, and with [Eater’s 2023 Chef of the Year](/23939547/eater-awards-winners-dc-2023#:~:text=Masako%20Morishita%3A%20Chef%20of%20the%20Year&text=Standout%20creations%20under%20her%20watch,a%20snowy%20blanket%20of%20parmesan.) (and 2024 [James Beard Award](/2024/1/24/24049141/2024-james-beard-awards-restaurant-and-chef-semifinalists-dc) winner for Emerging Chef of the Year) Masako Morishita at the helm, the revitalized Adams Morgan restaurant is generating lots of attention for her flavorful Japanese creations. Standout starters include a Japanese take on ceviche with shrimp, scallops, octopus, and fish eggs; crispy kaarage fried chicken; and garlic edamame dumplings hidden under a snowy blanket of parmesan. The sleek, wood-framed restaurant with a strong sake collection continues to host one of D.C.’s [best drag brunches](/maps/best-drag-brunches-in-dc) on Sundays, with plenty of playful cocktails like the Not an Espresso Martini made with cacao nib tea. Morishita introduced [Japanese breakfast service](/2023/10/11/23913253/perrys-dc-japanese-breakfast-service-masako-morishita-coming-attractions) on select Saturdays as well; both [the drag brunch](https://www.perrysam.com/brunch) and [breakfast service require reservations on Resy.](https://resy.com/cities/washington-dc/venues/perrys/events/japanese-breakfast-2025-05-03?date=2025-04-08&seats=2)

**Must-try dish:** The shrimp katsu burger combines a deep fried shrimp patty with cheddar cheese and togarashi tartar. Catch happy hour at the bar (from 4 to 7 p.m. daily) to get the stellar sandwich for only $12.

## Elmina

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner

**Price range:** $$

Food Network star Eric Adjepong puts a modern spin on traditional West African food at his [first brick-and-mortar restaurant](https://www.instagram.com/elminarestaurantdc/followers/). Open since February, [Elmina](https://www.elminarestaurant.com/?fbclid=PAZXh0bgNhZW0CMTEAAaZvHABYZzqdv-x_A9kGPGOHQHiHod1qkAF-M9WYaW4vZ8Gb3qPQxbWqH4U_aem_nPNogRcEW18XcbXCvdlK1Q) showcases classic Ghanaian dishes like fufu and kelewele (spicy fried plantains) across a la carte and tasting menus, along with new interpretations like spicy cassava udon noodles and egusi hummus. Situated in Seven Reasons’ former 14th Street NW home, two-story Elmina carves out room for 124 diners. The *Top Chef* Season 16 finalist also introduces the same roti flatbreads and doubles that were supposed to be featured at [On the Double,](/2020/3/5/21164929/eric-adjepong-restaurant-opening-on-the-double-caribbean-stall-union-market-food-hall-dc-roti) his fast-casual Union Market stall that fell through during the pandemic. Cocktails turn to regional flavors like mango, hibiscus, soursop, and passionfruit.

**Fun fact:** Elmina just tacked on [Dawa](https://www.dawakitchen.com/) inside, a casual takeout featuring the West African flavors Adjepong’s known for.

## Ceibo

**Open for:** Dinner

**Price range:** $$

Local hospitality vets Juan and Manuel Olivera granted [Adams Morgan a candle-lit getaway](/2023/10/30/23938792/inside-ceibo-adams-morgan-uruguay-dc-restaurant-openings) that pays homage to the brothers’ native Uruguay and its surrounding countries. Two-level Ceibo — the name refers to the flowering tree blooming at the bottom of the South American continent — captures the communal culture of asado, or preparing meats like beef, pork, and chorizo over an open flame. On the seafood side, highlights include oysters adorned with caviar farmed in Uruguay and Patagonian shrimp caught off the icy Atlantic coast of Argentina. Sweet potatoes, one of Uruguay’s biggest exports, play a prevalent part in the menu as savory starters, dessert, and inside drinks. A dimly lit downstairs bar spotlights South American wines, spirits, and other earthy ingredients and stays open until late on weekends. A popular Monday night sandwich pop-up full of Cubanos and Uruguay’s meaty chivitos (sliced steak) entered the fold this summer.

**Best for:** Intimate date night (with a toned-down noise level on Sunday evenings)

## Joon

**Open for:** Weekday lunch, brunch, and dinner

**Price range:** $$$$

[Joon](https://www.eatjoon.com/) continues to rack up accolades for its upscale takes on Iranian cuisine since opening in June 2023, with [James Beard semifinalist nods](/2024/1/24/24049141/2024-james-beard-awards-restaurant-and-chef-semifinalists-dc), joining the *New York Times*’ [50 Best Restaurants in America,](https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/dining/best-restaurants-america.html) and more. If you’re looking for smaller bites, any iteration of the hummus and kashke bademjan (a roasted eggplant dip topped with crispy onions) pairs perfectly with [drinks at May Bar,](/2024/5/8/24152295/iranian-joon-tysons-corner-new-lounge-dc-restaurant-openings) a beautiful lounge in front of the royal blue dining room where diners sip on classic cocktails with Persian flavors. ## Amparo Fondita

**Open for:** Dinner, plus Friday lunch and weekend brunch

**Price range:** $$

After years of searching for the right space, acclaimed chef and Oyamel alum Christian Irabién finally found a Dupont home for his long-awaited ode to modern Mexican cuisine and his roots. The Chihuahua, Mexico native, who grew up working in his grandfather’s Mexican restaurant in El Paso, seamlessly melds coastal flavors, seafood, and local seasonal ingredients, as in an expertly engineered salsa with ramps and a soft shell crab sandwich topped with red onion-habanero escabeche and green tomatoes. The constantly changing lineup may include a tropical big eye tuna ceviche surrounded with bright passionfruit and fresno; briny, mezcal-friendly oysters; and nixtamalized corn masa cakes topped with grilled pineapple.

Chef Rob Rubba puts vegetables on a pedestal, so Oyster Oyster’s presence in Shaw is ideal for diners who don’t eat meat but still want to enjoy an avant-garde tasting menu with a Michelin star. ## Shia

**Open for:** Dinner

**Price range:** $$$$

This [hidden Korean tasting menu spot](/2024/11/14/24295812/edward-lee-shia-korean-food-sustainability-union-market-dc-restaurant-openings) is actually a nonprofit restaurant from celebrity chef Edward Lee (who created pint-sized [Shia](/2024/11/14/24295812/edward-lee-shia-korean-food-sustainability-union-market-dc-restaurant-openings) late last year) where the team experiments with sustainable alternatives for restaurants. That means not using any plastic in the kitchen, firing up all-electric cookware, and making physical menus and coasters from leftover paper. The research in the kitchen hasn’t stopped the team from making cutting-edge Korean food in a prix fixe format that invites diners into the open kitchen, where they snack on first bites while chatting with chef de cuisine Max Chuvalas at the counter before diving into black sesame guksu (saucy cold noodles) topped with caviar, delicate seared black grouper with house-made fish cake, and a Korean mustard-glazed duck with umami-rich black garlic sauce. There are seven- ($185) and five-course ($100) options, plus a la carte snacks at the bar and $75 beverage pairings. Don’t skip out on the drinks, there are plenty of rare soju and sake options on the menu, along with Korean takes on classic cocktails like a toasted pine nut Old Fashioned.

**Know before you go**: The five-course menu is served in the front bar area, not in the open kitchen dining room, but you can ask for a peek into the cave-like kitchen during the shortened tasting.

* [1252 4th Street Northeast, Washington, District of Columbia 20002](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Shia%2C%201252%204th%20Street%20Northeast%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020002)

D.C.’s century-old boutique hotel hideaway got a big 2023 glow-up full of French-Southern flair under culinary partner Ian Boden, the James Beard-nominated chef behind The Shack in Staunton, Virginia. ## Casa Teresa

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner Monday through Saturday

**Price range:** $$$

Spanish chef Rubén García’s [flagship restaurant](/2023/11/6/23949485/inside-downtown-new-casa-teresa-spanish-ruben-garcia-chef-dc-restaurant-openings) and tapas bar brought a lively new destination for live-fire cooking to the Square, downtown’s [ambitious new food market](/2023/9/5/23860090/inside-the-square-dc-most-ambitious-food-market-downtown-openings) spearheaded by García and fellow José Andrés Group veteran Richie Brandenburg. Casa Teresa, García’s first solo venture, revives ancestral recipes of the culinary matriarchs he grew up around in Terrassa, Spain, and celebrates the time-honored cooking traditions of Basque Country and Catalonia through family-style feasts — think whole fish, local veggies, and pass-the-plate meats — all theatrically grilled over open flames and oak charcoal from a kitchen within diners’ view. The terracotta-toned dining room carves out space for a bar centered around gins, vermouth, and Spanish wines, plus an intimate “Teresa’s Table” that encourages chatty chef-guest interactions over tastings. A [Saturday brunch](https://www.sevenrooms.com/experiences/casateresa/brunch-the-spanish-way-11486168452) full of vermouth and family recipes entered the fold this spring.

**Must-try dish:** The How to Pa Amb Tomáquet is a fun dish that supplies diners with the crispy cristal bread, sliced tomatoes, and high-quality olive oil to build their own pan con tomate, plus a fun illustration card showing you how it’s done.

## Baan Siam

**Open for:** Lunch, dinner

**Price range:** $$

At this roomy Thai restaurant in Mt. Vernon Triangle, chef Jeeraporn Poksupthon has a kitchen worthy of her skill and ambition. Poksupthon led large catering kitchens in Thailand before she helped [usher a wave of chile-fueled Northern and Northeastern cooking into D.C. at now-closed Baan Thai in Logan Circle.](/2020/1/23/21078445/baan-thai-chef-opening-baan-siam-restaurant-mt-vernon-triangle-dc-spring-2020) At Baan Siam, she’s playing the hits — creamy, crunchy, and complex khao soi; tapioca skin dumplings with ground chicken, peanuts, and sweet fermented radish; and all sorts of spicy-sweet salads — while exploring sour-leaning dishes from her home country’s interior and ultra-hot curries from the South. ## Tapori

**Open for:** Dinner

**Price range:** $$

The team behind [critically acclaimed](/maps/dc-best-restaurants-38) [Daru](https://www.darudc.com/) doubled down on H Street in early 2025 with a vibrant new [South Indian restaurant and cocktail bar](/2025/2/25/24371678/tapori-funky-oasis-southeast-asian-street-food-h-street-dc-restaurant-openings). Tapori, which means “vagabond” in Hindi, centers around communal eating and flavors that span from Kerala to Nepal. Nepalese chef Suresh Sundas and beverage director Dante Datta teamed up with faraway chef Baburam Sharma to develop a menu that reflects his Nepalese background, upbringing in Delhi, and decades of experience in cooking South Indian cuisine. Dishes like pani puri, vada pav, dosas, and a clever “chop” riff on paneer join cocktails made with indigenous spices and fruits like chaat masala, jackfruit puree, and hibiscus.

The former home of Fancy Radish got a complete overhaul from Edit Lab, complete with a 20-person communal table, patchwork tile-covered bar, and booths peering into a bright open kitchen.

**Must-try dish:** The red-tinged Cauliflower 65 starter is a deep-fried favorite, dusted with roasted garlic, curry leaf, and mustard seed.

## Centrolina

Nearly a decade in, seven-time James Beard nominee chef Amy Brandwein’s polished osteria continues to shine in CityCenter DC. The five-time James Beard Award finalist goes all in on seasonal ingredients to construct a frequently changing Italian menu; that could mean melon-flanked snapper sashimi; peachy gazpacho; pristine pastas pumped up with purple broccoli and eggplant ragu; wood-fired mains like halibut and chanterelle mushrooms, lamb rib-eye, and pancetta-wrapped rabbit. ## SER Restaurant

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner

**Price range:** $$

Ten years in, Spanish stalwart Ser continues to shine in its evolving Ballston neighborhood. It’s hard to go wrong with any of the 12-plus tapas on the list, but the tomato bread, croquetas, and deep-fried eggplant are not to miss. Seafood, meat, or vegetable paella for two is another excellent choice, and for a dash of drama at the table, go big with a whole roast suckling pig. ## Ama

**Open for:** Morning-to-night service

**Price range:** $$

Open since June, Navy Yard’s [elegant new Italian eatery](/2024/6/6/24172532/aperitivo-hour-navy-yard-new-ama-italian-dc-restaurant-openings) comes courtesy of husband-and-wife industry vets Micah Wilder (Chaplin’s, Zeppelin) and Johanna Hellrigl (formerly of Doi Moi, Proof, Mercy Me). Drawing influence from chef Hellrigl’s northern Italian heritage, Ama transitions from an indoor-outdoor caffè and Genovese-style focacceria by day into an afternoon aperitivo bar and convivial restaurant by night. Kick off dinner with hard-to-get Tuscan salami and a peppery fennel salad, followed by mains like comforting rabbit stew served with homemade sourdough, spaghetti al pomodoro, and gloriously good gelato served in sliver cups. Negronis, spritzes, frozen Bellinis, and martinis take center stage at the bar come 4 p.m. A morning “cafè bancone” component showcases coffee and pastries starting at 8 a.m.

**Must-try dish:** Lasagna engineered with mushroom bechamel

* [885 New Jersey Avenue Southeast, Washington, District of Columbia 20003](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Ama%2C%20885%20New%20Jersey%20Avenue%20Southeast%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020003)
* [202-830-2505](tel:2028302505)
* [Visit website](https://www.amarestaurant.bar/)

## Fish Shop

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner

**Price range:** $$$

Scotland’s decorated seafood stop [Fish Shop](https://fishshopballater.co.uk/?srsltid=AfmBOopRG1vUG6p_c8iBB4Rs_qGzlEmGwDS8A-o5X4sWq_hTMHHUT_0t) traveled across the pond to [plant roots at the Wharf this spring with next-level nautical decor.](/2025/4/24/24415818/uk-fish-shop-washington-dc-opening-wharf) The Bib Gourmand-designated restaurant and fishmonger, named one of the [best new restaurants](https://www.cntraveler.com/story/best-new-restaurants-in-the-world-hot-list-2024) in the world by *Conde Nast Traveller*, comes from the London-based team behind high-powered art world hospitality group [Artfarm](https://artfarm.com/). At Fish Shop’s first stateside location, chef de cuisine [Ria Montes](https://www.instagram.com/ria_paz/) steers a hyperlocal [menu](/2025/4/24/24415818/uk-fish-shop-washington-dc-opening-wharf) full of crab-topped crumpets, Tall Timbers oysters grilled with ‘nduja brown butter, roasted rockfish, and vegetables sourced from the Dupont farmers market.

**Best for:** Everything from date night to big groups in search of a scenic private dining room overlooking the Southwest Waterfront.

* [610 Water Street Southwest, Washington, District of Columbia 20024](https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=Fish%20Shop%2C%20610%20Water%20Street%20Southwest%2C%20Washington%2C%20District%20of%20Columbia%2020024)

## Albi

**Open for:** Dinner

**Price range:** $$$

The 2024 James Beard Award winner for Outstanding Chef Michael Rafidi manipulates smoke with a master’s touch, sending out dishes from the wood-burning hearth at [his recently renovated, high-end Palestinian restaurant](/2025/4/2/24398884/albi-michael-rafidi-navy-yard-michelin-star-dc-restaurant-reopenings) that have a way of commanding a diner’s full attention. The Maryland native’s tweaks dishes to incorporate peak produce — see the crab hummus decorated with sunflower shoots — but the snack-sized lamb meat pies with toum and lemon should never go out of style. Cocktails, desserts, and a lengthy wine list full of [hard-to-find Eastern Mediterranean labels](/2021/4/7/22348707/dc-middle-eastern-restaurant-albi-levantine-wines) all rise to the occasion. An a la carte menu joins a new five-course “Sofra” menu ($145) that’s a surprise on the plate every night, plus $65-$95 beverage pairings. For something more affordable, head to sibling cafe Yellow, [which expanded to Georgetown](/2022/6/15/23170052/michelin-rated-albi-sibling-cafe-georgetown) with [fiery pies at night](/2023/9/22/23884600/acclaimed-levantine-cafe-yellow-dinner-georgetown-michael-rafidi), and added a Union Market locale [with lively Levantine bar La’ Shukran up top](/2024/9/18/24248481/inside-la-shukran-dc-funky-levantine-cocktail-bar-dc-openings).

**Best for:** Date night, larger groups, an arak cocktail, and everything in between

## Shilling Canning Company

**Open for:** Dinner and weekend brunch

**Price range:** $$

Chef Reid Shilling puts mid-Atlantic ingredients on a pedestal at his 5-year-old Navy Yard restaurant and raw bar, devoting an entire menu page to credit the dairy, oyster, cattle, and produce purveyors helping build his seasonal dishes at any given time. A seven-course tasting option gives diners a front-row seat of the wood-burning action, with a la carte available too. Highlights include Chesapeake rockfish with Karma Farm carrots, squash blossoms dressed with basil from Shilling’s own on-site garden, and Autumn Olive pork rib-eye sweetened up with honey-poached apricots from Ridgeview Farms. Shilling puts his preservation skills on full display in clear glass jars around the dining room, and bobbing blueberries or blackberries may make their way into a dreamy dessert on any given night.

**Fun fact:** [Fancy Ranch](https://www.fancyranchdc.com/), the team’s Amish chicken pop-up in Union Market, will be replaced with a surprise new oyster one soon.

## Mama Chang

**Open for:** Lunch and dinner

**Price range:** $$

The “home-style” Chinese restaurant in Peter Chang’s portfolio pays tribute to the women that influenced the legendary former embassy chef, with fiery dishes that call back his childhood in the Hubei province of central China and his home life in Virginia. Chang, a master of numbing spice, has woven Sichuan and Hunan techniques into a menu of vegetable-heavy plates, dim sum, and family-style orders. And there’s more to like in Chang’s sprawling empire: There’s dine-in seating across its plant-filled, zen [dining room](/2019/2/27/18243222/mama-chang-eater-inside-fairfax) in Fairfax. The famed Chinese chef planted roots in Dupont Circle [with the opening of Chang Chang](/2022/10/4/23387771/sichuan-peter-chang-chang-chang-dc-restaurant-openings-dupont), his first-ever D.C. restaurant with a [supersized menu](/2023/9/26/23890863/chef-peter-chang-dc-menu-chang-chang-dupont-coming-soon). The latest namesake spot (his 19th restaurant to date) is coming to Alexandria, following up 2024 NoVa openings in Herndon and [NiHao in National Landing.](/2024/5/9/24153007/arlington-national-landing-new-nihao-chinese-peter-chang-dc-restaurant-openings)

**Must-try dish:** Scallion bubble pancakes

* [(703) 268-5556](tel:7032685556)

# Restaurant Experts Pick D.C.’s Best Dining Neighborhood

Waterfronts were hot this year

by [Warren Rojas](https://www.eater.com/authors/warren-rojas)

Recreation Pier at the newly renovated southwest waterfront.

 Photo: the [Wharf](https://www.facebook.com/TheWharfDC/photos/a.727148824002467.1073741826.724037170980299/1625478567502817/?type=3&theater)

[Part Of

The Year in Eater

see all updates](/2015/12/30/10688358/the-year-in-eater)

*As per tradition, Eater asked a group of restaurant critics, journalists, bloggers, and friends of the site to weigh in on the year in food. Here are the geographic areas that caught their attention.*

**David Hagedorn, *Arlington Magazine/Bethesda Magazine* dining columnist:** “My neighborhood, [Adams Morgan](/neighborhood/1914/adams-morgan), is in the middle of a tremendous resurgence. We have [Lapis](/venue/38894/lapis-bistro), [Johnny’s Half-Shell](/venue/6722/johnnys-half-shell), [Mintwood Place](/venue/3550/mintwood-place), [Perry’s](/maps/best-dc-rooftops-bars-restaurants/perrys-restaurant), [Pitango Gelato + Café](/2017/10/27/16559878/pitango-gelato-cafe-adams-morgan-opening), and [Tail up Goat](/venue/27469/tail-up-goat) in just about one stretch, plus [Federalist Pig](/2017/12/22/16812562/rob-sonderman-federalist-pig-one-year-in), [Donburi](/venue/10675/donburi), [Jack Rose](/venue/5926/jack-rose) and Dram and Grain. And the [Line hotel on the verge of fully opening](/2017/12/20/16798110/brothers-and-sisters-cup-we-all-race-4-a-rakes-bar-adams-morgan-open).”

**Rina Rapuano, *Zagat DC*/freelance food writer:** “[U Street](/neighborhood/1899/u-street), the [Wharf](/2017/10/12/16463944/wharf-grand-opening), [Shaw](/neighborhood/1927/shaw), [Penn Quarter](/neighborhood/1918/penn-quarter).”

**Don Rockwell, *DC Dining*:** “Shaw and environs (I’ll be surprised if this isn’t unanimous).”

**Jessica Sidman, *Washingtonian* food editor:** “Shaw.”

**Tim Carman, *Washington Post* food writer:** “Shaw, without question. If one place is packed for the night, there are so many other options, each a destination of its own way: [All-Purpose](/venue/23804/all-purpose). The [Dabney](/venue/20016/the-dabney) (my recent meal there was my best yet). [Smoked & Stacked](/venue/25497/smoked-stacked). [Espita [Mezcaleria]](/venue/22120/espita-mezcaleria). The [Columbia Room](/venue/32575/the-columbia-room). [Tiger Fork](/venue/38011/tiger-fork). [Convivial](/venue/20038/convivial). I would also include such Ethiopian gems as CherCher and [Queen of Sheba](/2017/7/25/16025870/queen-of-sheba-dc-opening-ethiopia).”

**Stefanie Gans, *Northern Virginia Magazine* restaurant critic and dining editor:** “Barracks Row.”

**Nevin Martell, *DC Modern Luxury* dining editor:** “Anywhere but [Silver Spring](/neighborhood/1979/silver-spring), where I live. Talk about a dining desert! Though I do have to give credit to [Urban Butcher](/venue/12196/urban-butcher) for being one of the few bright spots. Restaurateurs: please open some new spots out there. It’s a well-educated, well-heeled community that’s dying for new options.”

**Laura Hayes, *Washington City Paper* food editor:** “Shaw, 14th Street, [Navy Yard](/neighborhood/1954/navy-yard).”

**Tom Sietsema, *Washington Post* restaurant critic:** “Mouthwatering Shaw has a potential rival in the Wharf.”

**Lori Gardner, *Been There, Eaten That*:** “The Wharf took D.C. by storm.”
